trip.title: Paris: The Perfect Weekend
trip.subtitle: 2 Days • Spring/Summer • €150-250/day
trip.description: Experience the magic of Paris in just 48 hours. This carefully crafted itinerary hits the iconic landmarks while revealing the hidden corners that make Paris truly special. Perfect for first-time visitors or those returning for a romantic weekend.

days.title: Icons & Left Bank Charm
days.subtitle: From the Eiffel Tower to Saint-Germain cafés
days.summary: Start with Paris's most famous landmark early, then dive into the intellectual heart of the Left Bank

activities.description:
• 7:30am: Start at Trocadéro for sunrise Eiffel Tower photos (no crowds!)
• 8:30am: Breakfast at Café de l'Homme (terrace view of tower)
• 10am: Eiffel Tower visit - book skip-the-line tickets for 2nd floor

gems.title: Secret Eiffel View
gems.description: Skip the Trocadéro crowds. Walk down to Port Debilly (the small port on the Seine) for the most romantic tower photos with boats in foreground.
gems.insiderInfo: Best at golden hour - 30 min before sunset

gems.title: Tower Ticket Hack
gems.description: Book stairs + elevator combo ticket. Climb to 2nd floor (€10.70), then elevator to summit (€6.60 extra). Saves €10 and skips elevator queue!
gems.insiderInfo: Only works if you're reasonably fit - it's 674 steps

activities.description:
• Metro to Saint-Germain-des-Prés
• Lunch at L'Avant Comptoir (standing tapas bar, no reservations)
• Browse Shakespeare & Company bookstore
• Stroll through Luxembourg Gardens
• 4pm: Musée Rodin (gardens alone worth the €10)

gems.title: L'Avant Comptoir Secret
gems.description: This tiny standing-room tapas bar has no sign, just look for the crowd at 3 Carrefour de l'Odéon. Order the Jambon Ibérique and duck confit croquettes. Wine is €4/glass!
gems.insiderInfo: Go at 2pm or after 4pm to avoid lunch rush

activities.description:
• 7pm: Seine river walk from Pont Neuf to Notre-Dame
• 8:30pm: Dinner at Les Papilles (wine shop + bistro, one menu, always perfect)
• 10:30pm: Eiffel Tower sparkle show (every hour on the hour until 1am)

gems.title: Les Papilles
gems.description: This wine shop/bistro serves one menu that changes daily - no choices, just trust them. €38 for 4 courses. The catch? It's always incredible and you can buy any bottle off the shelf at retail price.

days.title: Montmartre Magic & Marais Wandering
days.subtitle: Artists' quarters and hidden courtyards
days.summary: Explore the village feel of Montmartre, then get lost in the Marais maze

activities.description:
• 8:30am: Métro to Abbesses (keep your ticket for the prettiest station!)
• 9am: Sacré-Cœur before the crowds
• 10am: Get lost in Montmartre backstreets
• 11am: Coffee at La Consulat (Van Gogh's old haunt)

gems.title: La Maison Rose Alternative
gems.description: Everyone Instagrams La Maison Rose. Instead, find Square Marcel Bleustein - a hidden garden with the same pink houses but zero tourists. Enter through a tiny gate at 92 Rue des Saules.

gems.title: Sacré-Cœur Secret Entrance
gems.description: Skip the main stairs. Take the funicular (use a metro ticket) or better yet, enter through Square Louise Michel's side garden path - prettier and less crowded.
gems.insiderInfo: Funicular is included in your metro ticket

activities.description:
• Métro to Le Marais
• Lunch at L'As du Fallafel (Sunday-Thursday only)
• Explore Place des Vosges (Paris's oldest square)
• Get lost in the Jewish quarter
• 4pm: Musée Carnavalet (Paris history museum - FREE!)

gems.title: Village Saint-Paul
gems.description: Hidden network of courtyards filled with antique shops and cafés. Enter through any passage marked 'Village Saint-Paul' between Rue Saint-Paul and Rue Charlemagne. Feels like a secret medieval village.

activities.description:
• 6pm: Aperitif at Le Mary Celeste (oysters + cocktails)
• 8pm: Dinner at Breizh Café (modern crêperie, need reservation)
• 10pm: Night stroll along the illuminated Seine
• 11pm: Late-night wine at La Belle Hortense (wine bar + bookstore)

gems.title: Breizh Café Ordering Secret
gems.description: This isn't your tourist crêperie. Order the 'Complète' with Bordier butter (€14) and a bottle of artisanal cider. Save room for the salted caramel dessert crêpe.
gems.insiderInfo: 109 Rue Vieille du Temple. Book at breizh-cafe.com
